required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Observational Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of NovoMix® 30 in Type 1 and 2 Diabetes
clinical_study.official_title: EFFicacious glycaEmia Control, Treatment Goal achIevement Very simplE With NovoMix 30: A Single-country, Multicentre, Prospective, Open Label, Non-controlled, Observational, 26-week Study in Serbian Patients Using NovoMix® 30 (Biphasic Insulin Aspart 30) for Treatment of Diabetes Mellitus in Everyday Clinical Practice

brief_summary.textblock: This study is conducted in Europe. This observational study is aimed to reflect the post-authorisation experience with insulin analogue (biphasic insulin aspart 30) when used under normal clinical practice conditions in Serbia.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of patients achieving HbA1c below 7,5% for Type 1 Diabetes Mellitus, below 7.0% and below or equal to 6.5% for Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus
secondary_outcome.time_frame: after 12 weeks and 26 weeks compared to baseline
after 12 weeks and 26 weeks compared to baseline
after 12 weeks and 26 weeks compared to baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in insulin dose and number of injections
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 12 weeks and 26 weeks of treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in oral antidiabetic drug therapy dosage and eventual discontinuation of oral antidiabetic drug therapy during the study
secondary_outcome.time_frame: after 12 weeks and 26 weeks of treatment compared to baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in body weight and waist circumference
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 12 weeks and 26 weeks of treatment compared to baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in number of major hypoglycaemic events during 4 weeks proceeding routine visits
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 12 weeks and 26 weeks of treatment compared to baseline
after 12 weeks and 26 weeks of treatment

intervention.description: There is no intervention in this trial. The trial is prepared to be non-interventional one. Start dose and frequency to prescribed by the physician as a result of a normal clinical evaluation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Type 1 or Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus inadequately controlled on human insulin therapy lasting for at least 6 months
- HbA1c greater than 7%
- Informed Consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with a hypersensitivity to biphasic insulin aspart 30 or to any of the excipients
- Other limiting conditions specified in the locally approved NovoMix 30 SPC ( Summary of Product Characteristics), PIL ( Patient Information Leaflet).
- Women who are pregnant, breast feeding or have the intention of becoming pregnant within next couple of months

intervention_browse.mesh_term: Insulin aspart, insulin aspart protamine drug combination 30:70
